description._content: When plans for the new Talmud Torah building were being formulated in the mid 1910s, there was a groundswell of support for a facility that would include not only classrooms, by social and recreational space for young people in the community. There was plea for funding for a Talmud Torah gymnasium. Public pressure resulted in several community organizations pledging to fund activities for teenaged boys and girls. The sports programs were overseen by a new administrative unit, the Talmud Torah Social Service department. Date: 1920 Source: 24 cm x 16 cm Format: Black and white original photo Subject: Sports and recreation; Talmud Torah--Minneapolis--Before 1930 Coverage: Minneapolis; Hennepin; Minnesota; United States Local Identifier: S1C-4 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,369 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
